definition[0]: a substance used to make food or drink taste sweeter
example[0]: No artificial sweeteners are used in this product.
definition[1]: something that you give to someone to persuade them to do something, especially to accept a business deal
example[1]: These tax cuts are just a pre-election sweetener.
definition[2]: something used to make an offer, suggestion etc seem more attractive
example[2]: The latest response from the government is a reported Â£20 million sweetener for UK businesses.
example[3]: As a sweetener, managers who retire by Dec. 30 will receive an extra 15% on their pension.
definition[3]: a BRIBE (=illegal or unfair payment made to someone to persuade them to do something)
example[4]: It had a reputation as a country where every transaction required a sweetener.
